organism.scientificName: Saccharolobus shibatae (strain ATCC 51178 / DSM 5389 / JCM 8931 / NBRC 15437 / B12)

texts.value: DNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RNAP) catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates
Part of the 13-subunit RNA polymerase complex
Belongs to the archaeal Rpo3/eukaryotic RPB3 RNA polymerase subunit family
X-ray crystallography in this and other archaea shows this protein binds a 3Fe-4S cluster, although a 4Fe-4S cluster has been suggested to be present in this protein

citation.title: Evolution of complex RNA polymerases: the complete archaeal RNA polymerase structure.

referencePositions: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (3.35 ANGSTROMS) OF THE RNA POLYMERASE COMPLEX IN COMPLEX WITH IRON-SULFUR (3FE-4S)

citation.title: New insights into the diversity and evolution of the archaeal mobilome from three complete genomes of Saccharolobus shibatae.
Archaeal RNA polymerase: the influence of the protruding stalk in crystal packing and preliminary biophysical analysis of the Rpo13 subunit.

referencePositions: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (3.80 ANGSTROMS) OF THE RNA POLYMERASE COMPLEX IN COMPLEX WITH IRON-SULFUR (3FE-4S)

citation.title: Structural and functional analyses of the interaction of archaeal RNA polymerase with DNA.

referencePositions: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (3.20 ANGSTROMS) OF THE RNA POLYMERASE COMPLEX IN COMPLEX WITH IRON-SULFUR (3FE-4S) WITH AND WITHOUT DNA
